text:
Jimin doesn’t remember the last time he felt this content. The blanket over him is just right, he’s in bed early with his mate’s arms around him and his brain’s just going under, but still conscious enough to note how content he was. All is right in the world, and he’s never laughing at Yoongi’s intense love for blankets and naps again.

 

Of course, because the moment is just too perfect, the moment is interrupted with ringing from his phone.

 

“Just ignore it,” Yoongi mutters into Jimin’s neck as the omega cranes his head around to look at the caller ID. “Who the fuck’s calling this late?”

 

“It’s Tae,” Jimin murmurs, wiggling out of Yoongi’s arms. “It could be an emergency. Go to sleep, babe.” Yoongi doesn’t seem pacified from Jimin’s absentminded kiss on his forehead and sits up with his mate and stays there, arms crossed and glaring. Jimin didn’t stop himself from smiling at how cute he looks.

 

“Taetae? Is something wrong?”

 

“Jiminie…” Taehyung’s voice is rougher, breathier than usual.

 

“Is it your heat? It’s bad?”

 

“You know I wouldn’t call...if it wasn’t so bad,” Taehyung manages to pant. He would curse the stars and planets if he had the energy, but he’s too busy focusing on distracting himself from all the feelings on his body.

 

“Did you take suppressants? How long has it been?” Jimin’s already swinging his legs over the side of the bed as Yoongi groans and follows. “No, stay in bed, babe,” Jimin said, covering the phone with his chest. Yoongi just glared pointedly and rummaged around for a hoodie.

 

“I ran out,” Taehyung wails. “And I can’t go out like this, Jiminie, what am I going to-”

 

“I’m coming, Tae. It’s the same brand? I’ll grab you some.”

 

Taehyung sniffled pitifully. “Ice cream?”

 

“Okay, I’ll get ice cream,” Jimin says soothingly. “I’ll bring the alpha too.” Yoongi huffs indignantly in the background.

 

“You’re an angel, Jiminie,” Taehyung says and the line goes dead.

 

“The alpha? That’s all I am to you?” Yoongi mutters as he stuffs his feet in some sneakers.

 

Jimin smiles brightly. “You’re my alpha.”

 

“Yeah,” Yoongi says, totally satisfied but still trying to look gruff.

 

“You don’t have to come, babe,” Jimin adds as he put his shoes on. “You should rest. I’ll be fine.”

 

“‘s fine,” Yoongi grumbles. “I’m up anyway.”

 

“You sure?”

 

“I’m your alpha,” Yoongi says, shrugging, and Jimin beams.

 

The couple manages to track down a convenience store to get suppressants and ice cream; Yoongi only glares at two people for looking at Jimin before they make it to Taehyung’s apartment. It’s messy and chaotic as usual, except the smell of the heat makes the chaos all the more overwhelming. The scent isn’t as bad for mated wolves, but Yoongi still buries his face into Jimin’s neck to recalibrate.

 

They’re all used to this by now -- Taehyung, successful celebrity author or not, is a total child when he tries do real life; it doesn’t help that Taehyung’s heats are just as wonky and irregular as the omega himself.

 

“Taetae?” Jimin calls, heading straight for the bedroom while Yoongi grabs spoons and a glass of water for the pills and ice cream.

 

“Chimchim,” Taehyung whimpers into his pillow. “I sick.”

 

“I know,” Jimin starts rubbing circles into Taehyung’s back and the omega relaxes slightly. “You idiot, why can’t you take care of yourself better?”

 

“Yoongi-hyung took you away from me, the fucker,” Taehyung says with a weak smile.

 

“You brat, Taehyung, take your goddamn pill,” Yoongi says, setting the medicine and water on the bedside table. Taehyung ignores it and eyes the ice cream in the alpha’s hands. “Ice cream?”

 

“Rocky road, but you don’t get any until you take the meds,” Yoongi says nonchalantly. “You stink.”

 

Taehyung scowls and pops the pill in his mouth; flopping back into bed, he pats the space next to him for Jimin. Yoongi settles himself at the foot of the bed, pulling Jimin’s legs into his lap.

 

“Thanks for coming,” Taehyung says eventually around a mouthful of ice cream. Jimin even knew what brand to get, and Taehyung sighs, letting the coldness soothe his overheating mouth. “Even you, Yoongs hyung.” The heat is still very much there, but with people around him it’s bearable. Jimin’s familiar scent and Yoongi’s alpha scent comforted Taehyung so he didn’t feel so alone and vulnerable. There is still a dull ache for sex, but that can be taken care of later.

 

“Of course we’ll come,” Jimin draws soothing circles on Taehyung’s stomach. “What would you do without us?”

 

“Die, probably,” Yoongi snorts and both omegas turned their heads to glare.

 

“I feel bad,” Taehyung whines. “My heat’s been so weird lately. I think it’s the deadline.”

 

“Don’t tell me you haven’t started,” Jimin says immediately, staring sternly (Yoongi thinks it’s still cute). “You told me you started.”

 

“I did! But it’s kind of stressing me out,” Taehyung admits.

 

Jimin softens. “I’m sure it’ll work out.”

 

“Stress heats,” Yoongi nods. “They’re a bitch. During finals one year-”

 

“Not relevant,” Jimin butts in, blushing slightly.

 

“I was a fuckpiece , Tae. I may as well be a dildo in Jimin’s toy box, I swear-”

 

“Yoongi,” Jimin whines. “Wait, that’s it!”

 

“What’s it, sweetheart?” Yoongi says in a resigned voice. Taehyung thought he sounded like a tired mother.

 

“Tae, you need a fuckpiece!”

 

“Huh? Like Yoongi hyung?”

 

“Yeah,” Jimin says excitedly. “Except Yoongi hyung’s my fuckpiece.”

 

“Thanks,” Yoongi mutters to no one in particular.

 

“Get an escort or something. Sugar baby? Alpha sugar baby, if that exists.”

 

“Nice, sunshine,” Yoongi grins. “You have the money for this, Tae. Stop spending it on weird shit and get your heat sorted out. You can even pay him to make you take your pills.”

 

“I know right?” Jimin says proudly.

 

Taehyung frowns. “Okay, but where do I find a sugar baby? An alpha one?”

 

“You’ve hired a full-time dog sitter, Taehyung, I’m sure you can find an alpha sugar baby,” Yoongi drawls. “Sunshine, can we go now? Tae’s eyeing his toy box and I really don’t want the visual.”

 

Jimin smirks. “We’ll leave you to it, Taetae. Call me if you need me!”

 

Taehyung pouts. “You made me think about fuckpieces, Yoongi, this is your fault!”

 

Yoongi shrugs again, already walking out of the room. “I have a client meeting tomorrow. Feel better!”

 

Jimin winks at Taehyung before following his mate. “Have fun!”

 

“Thanks for coming,” Taehyung says again, flashing a rectangular smile. Jimin notes that it’s back to its usual, all-teeth glory and smiles back.

 

“What are bros for?”


 

Taehyung spends the next few days in his apartment, going out only for necessity runs in Yoongi’s jacket because an omega in this world can never be too careful. It’s all very irritating; Taehyung is a spontaneous and social creature, and he can’t even go out for long before he starts to feel naked and vulnerable.

 

Most of the symptoms settles down after a few days, only to start up again once Taehyung’s started meeting friends and the like again. It sucks, Taehyung admits to himself. He’s been through so much, gotten himself published , dammit, and he’s still plagued with dumb, irregular heats like a teenager.

 

Taehyung is made for people, even when he wants to focus on himself and his work. He can’t keep calling Jimin and Yoongi for help, but he just needs company. Alpha company, without feeling obligated or guilty. Jimin is right -- Taehyung needs a live-in, in-house alpha fuckpiece.

 

It’s fine, this is the 21st century. If they’re both consenting adults, this is no different from paying someone for washing your car or walking your dog. Right? Taehyung pays someone to walk Soonshimie sometimes, when she’s visiting from Daegu and he’s busy with things. There’s nothing weird about this. Nope. Totally normal.

 

Doubting unorthodox decisions like this makes Taehyung thinks he’s losing his touch as “Taelien”, but oh well, he’s never thought he was that weird anyway. He goes ahead with a vague ad on Naver with his phone number and the alias V, and promptly forgets about the whole thing once his heat ends.


Taehyung’s in a hipster cafe for the afternoon when he gets the first phone call. The first thing he hears is “ let me make you feel good, omega ,” and he almost screeches, hanging up right away.

 

The second phone call comes a few days later when Taehyung’s just sat down in his favourite bakery for the day. The voice sounds younger, milder than the first caller, with zero sex-crazed scary alpha vibes.

 

“I’m not really sure what the job is. Could you give more details?” The voice is kind of musical, light and breathy and not alpha-esque at all.

 

“What’s your name?”

 

“Jungkook.”

 

“Could we meet up? I’m at a cafe near Seoul U.” Taehyung asks. He’s not creepy sounding and that’s all he needs, really.

 

“Text me the address?”

 

“Okay!” Taehyung chirps.

 

He quickly texts Jimin to call the police if he doesn’t hear from him in about two hours. Taehyung’s going to be a daddy ! His grandmother would be so excited.

 

He’s just ordered another vanilla strawberry latte (it’s not on the menu, but the owner loves him) when a cute, unassuming college student walks in and looks around for someone. He’s an alpha, Taehyung notes, and turns his attention to his computer.

 

“Um, V-ssi?” The kid is at his table now, peering at him nervously through round, dark eyes.

 

Taehyung gapes. “No way. You’re like...how old are you?”

 

The alpha looks offended. “I’m a senior!”

 

“In high school?”

 

“College!” Jungkook frowns, and Taehyung would be intimidated if he didn’t look so cute.

 

“Ah, sorry, Jungkookie! Sit down. Do you want coffee?”

 

“I’m fine,” Jungkook says. He looks steady, not like the bad tempered alphas at the corner store, demanding cigarettes and getting into pissing contests. He still smelled like dominance, but of a quiet sort -- like the salt in salted caramel, or the coffee in a mocha, quietly making itself known. Taehyung’s intrigued.

 

“You’re, um, younger than I thought,” Jungkook muttered.

 

“You too,” Taehyung replied brightly, closing his laptop and cradling his hands around his mug. “What do you study?”

 

“Fine arts,” Jungkook mutters, spine coiling. Must be hard, Taehyung thinks. Alphas these days seem to only be allowed to study engineering and physics and medicine. “And if you laugh at me--”

 

“Calm down,” Taehyung says easily. “I’m an author, who am I to look down on artists?”

 

“Okay.” There is a pause, and Jungkook doesn’t seem like he’s about to carry the conversation. Taehyung sighs. He’s not sure if this will work.

 

“So do you want to make small talk or should we just go for it?”

 

Jungkook raised his eyebrows. “Go for…?”

 

“I need someone to keep my stupid heat in check,” Taehyung explains. “I think they’re stress induced, and my deadline’s in a month. I just need it fucked out anytime it comes up. You’d be free to do whatever you want in between, but you’d have to come pretty fast-” Taehyung breaks into giggles here, then schools his expression as Jungkook’s face remains blank. “-for it to work, I mean. Like, come over. Or you could live with me, that’s a sugar daddy thing, right?”

 

Jungkook nods slowly. “Can you afford me?”

 

Taehyung scoffs. “You’re cute, but I’m cuter. I could find someone easily -”

 

“How many creepy calls have you gotten?” Jungkook asks. His eyes are the same as before, round and guileless, but Taehyung thinks he can catch a hint of a smirk on the alpha’s lips.

 

“Just one. And I’m richer than I look,” Taehyung bites out. What’s with this guy? Just because he wears comfy shirts with some personal DIY (which makes it look expensive, ok, that was the original point)--

 

Jungkook pulls out a pen, scribbles a number on a napkin.

 

“That’s my price. For the month.”

 

Taehyung raises his eyebrows. “Student loans?”

 

“Does it matter?”

 

“I guess not,” Taehyung says with his lips in an appraising frown. It’s more than his first signing bonus, but he’s had many bonuses. And cheques, and book tours.

 

Jungkook watches as the omega’s face lips stretch into a rectangular smile as the eyes morph into crescents. It makes Jungkook want to smile back.

 

“Call.”

 

Jungkook moves in that day, with everything he owned in a single duffel bag.

 

“Are you sure you can pay me?” Is the first thing Jungkook says as he takes in Taehyung’s apartment, and the omega groans. So it’s a little messy, but there are methods to his madness. A system. And what’s the point of getting a penthouse in Gangnam when he’s just going to trek it to Hongdae to write in the coffee shops? People are too stuffy anywhere else.

 

“Do you want me to give you an advance payment?” Taehyung asks exasperatedly.

 

Jungkook blushed and Taehyung thinks Jungkook looks more like a puppy than an alpha. “It would be nice.”

 

“Okay. I’ll wire you like 20,000,000 won? Is that enough?”

 

Jungkook’s eyebrows shoot up. “Yeah,” he says weakly.

 

Jungkook doesn’t relax after that. He stands around awkwardly, sometimes following Taehyung around the apartment as the older strolls around looking for extra blankets and toothbrushes. The steadiness at the coffee shop frays into fidgety hands and soft sniffles. (“Rhinitis,” Jungkook mutters, when Taehyung asks if he’s okay.)

 

“I’m not in heat now, so just relax. Do some school work or something,” Taehyung says unbothered by Jungkook standing awkwardly next to the fridge. “I’m going to do some work.”

 

“What do you do?”

 

“I’m a writer!” Taehyung points to a book on one of his bookshelves. “That thing and that thing came out of this ass. Don’t read them though, they’re shit.”

 

“Wow. You’re published.”

 

“How do you think I can afford an alpha to fuck me otherwise? With such a ridiculous price.” Taehyung scoffs. Jungkook scratches the back of his head. “I’m kidding. This doesn’t undermine your alpha-ness. Your student loans must be shit, though.”

 

“...okay.”


The first week is...awkward, to say the least. Jungkook lives like a ghost in Taehyung’s apartment -- the only indicator that someone else is even living there is the extra blanket perpetually thrown over the sofa and the extra toothbrush in the bathroom.

 

It did comes at the end of the first week. It’s Saturday, and Jungkook stays on the couch all morning doing something with his sketchbook while Taehyung taps away on his battered laptop at the kitchen table. It’s a companionable co-existence, with the constant keyboard tapping and pages rustling.

 

Then Taehyung’s pheromones go berserk and they both look up, staring at each other.

 

“Is it…?”

 

“Yes,” Taehyung half-snaps. “Get over here.”

 

So Jungkook sets his textbook aside, shuffles to beside Taehyung, and sits in a chair. “Uh... oh ,” He says weakly as Taehyung plops himself onto Jungkook’s lap.

 

“If you’re uncomfortable with this, now’s the time,” Taehyung says as he stuck his nose in Jungkook’s neck. Jungkook’s scent is already familiar -- faintly like coffee, but with slight tints of caramel. Sometimes, after a shower or just randomly throughout the day, Taehyung can catch a whiff of peppermint.

 

“It’s, uh, fine.” Jungkook’s not fine. His senses are racing into overdrive, processing the feel of Taehyung’s limbs around him and his lips on his neck and his smell around him. Jungkook can’t handle big doses of Taehyung, because he’s warm and soft and sparks too many unknown feelings.

 

(“Good morning,” Taehyung chirped one morning, and Jungkook was so overwhelmed by the rectangular smile and the brightness of everything that he just said, “Um,” and left the room.)

 

In heat, Taehyung is just too much . His scent, normally a fresh and flowery, turns somewhat heady; thicker, richer, maybe. If Taehyung smells like wildflowers and honey, in heat he is roses and blooming lilies and vanilla. Jungkook really can’t. Could someone smell so...kissable? Is that possible? This is what omegas are , Jungkook thinks. He’s really never been up close and personal with one -- everyone in his life’s been harping on about respecting and cherishing omegas and Jungkook’s just too awkward and terrible at social stuff so he’s just stayed away. Now, pressed between Taehyung and the hard kitchen chair, Jungkook wants to wrap his arms around Taehyung just to see what it would feel like. The thought makes him blush, but Taehyung doesn’t seem to notice.

 

Jungkook has started reevaluating all his life and choices when Taehyung whimpers, moving his hips around and Jungkook’s very very aware of where Taehyung’s dick is in relation to his own and oh god, there it goes--

 

“You’re okay with this? I hope you don’t mind if I just...help myself,” Taehyung mutters as he sets his feet on the floor to lift himself up, hands working at his sweatpants.

 

“Do what you gotta do,” Jungkook manages. He sounds a little constipated but at least his dick is still working.

 

Taehyung flashes another goddamn grin and Jungkook tries to focus on the omega’s teeth instead of those hands on his chest. “Relax.”

 

“Right,” Jungkook mutters. He lifts his hips as Taehyung gets rid of his basketball shorts.

 

“Nice, dude,” Taehyung whistles.

 

“Dude,” Jungkook repeats weakly. Taehyung sits himself on the kitchen table and leans back to stick a finger in himself, groaning.

 

When he’s two fingers in, Taehyung opens one eye to see Jungkook in the same position as he left him, having an internal crisis. “I really am doing all the work, huh? You okay?”

 

“Yeah,” Jungkook breathes.

 

“Have you not done this before?”

 

“I have,” Jungkook grits. But he may as well not have because he’s never felt so out of depth with someone else.

 

“At least go get a condom if you’re not going to help,” Taehyung smirks. “In my nightstand, second drawer.”

 

Jungkook shoots up, painfully aware of how ready his dick is and awkwardly half-runs to the bedroom.

 

“Wow, you’re fast,” Taehyung comments when Jungkook’s back, holding a condom packet in his hands and sitting back down on the chair. “Put it on.”

 

Jungkook does, and Taehyung sits himself onto him without warning, letting out a sigh of relief as he does.

 

(Jungkook may have let out an unattractive groan, but he doesn’t want to think about it.)

 

Taehyung lifts himself up a few more times and Jungkook works up the courage to kiss Taehyung’s chin, then his jawline, then his neck. They’re both considerably worked up when Jungkook realises that it’s not enough. His eyes flick to look at Taehyung’s face bangs moistened with beads of sweat. Taehyung sees the agitation in the crease between Jungkook’s brows.

 

“Do you mind if I--”

 

“Do what you gotta do,” Taehyung breathes. Jungkook nips his ear in protest and Taehyung laughs weakly, yelping as Jungkook wraps his arms around the omega and puts him on the kitchen table again.

 

“Can I--”

 

“Just give it to me,” Taehyung mutters, eyes dancing. “Alpha.”

 

Something snaps, and Jungkook grips his hands on Taehyung’s shoulders, arms under his back, and lets his hips go. His instincts tell him to growl, bite at Taehyung’s shoulder, press Taehyung down with his own chest, so he does. He keeps his nose against Taehyung’s neck, breathing him in as he pumps, faster and faster until the omega’s writhing under him, calling something incoherent. Jungkook doesn’t even have the mind to be awkward anymore because the only thing in his head and filling his senses is Taehyung, hot and needy and gasping under him, and Jungkook’s never felt so alive.

 

It’s a little clumsy, probably a little rough, but apparently it’s enough because out of nowhere they’re both coming. It’s silent for a few seconds as stars burst behind their eyes and the gasps come back, chests clashing together as their lungs stretch out and collapse.

 

“Sorry,” Jungkook mutters when he catches his breath. Taehyung still has his eyes closed under him, lips in a small, content smile.

 

“Don’t be. That was great.”

 

“Yeah? You feeling better?”

 

“Better,” Taehyung says, opening one eye. “Thanks. Or, I should thank your pheromones and whatever. You should market your services as a suppressant. 10/10 would bang again.”

 

Jungkook just splutters. He pulls out, somewhat undignified, and chucks the condom in the garbage under the sink.

 

“Lunch?”

 

“Oh, I can -- since you’re not feeling well-”

 

Taehyung snorts. “Please, Jungkook. I saw you eat that half raw egg the other time. I’d rather not get salmonella, thanks.” His cheeks are still flushed as he pulls his sweats back up and Jungkook feels somewhat pleased with himself looking at it.

 

Taehyung’s also more talkative in heat, Jungkook learned, as he blabbered away while he puttered around in the kitchen, content to let Jungkook stew at the table, absorbing the omega’s words without reply.

 

“...I really don’t believe in asparagus, Kookie -- I can call you Kookie, right? -- but Jiminie got too much that other day and Yoongi-hyung snuck some over because he wants to not barf, but I really don’t think this stuff could taste good, so we’ll just have to hack it…”

 

Even Taehyung’s voice os soothing, flowing and smoothing over Jungkook’s tired brain. He understands all those wars over omegas now. The bloody bar fights. Those ridiculous TV dramas.

 

“...Kookie, are you listening?”

 

Jungkook jolts. “Yeah.”

 

Taehyung laughs, and Jungkook wants him to do it again and again, just for him.



 

“We have a problem,” Taehyung says solemnly one day. “I haven’t bought you anything .”

 

“You buy me ramen. And ice cream. And milk,” Jungkook points out.

 

“But sugar daddy stuff. What kind of daddy am I if I don’t get you like, a sports car?”

 

“But you don’t even have a sports car.”

 

Taehyung blushes, and Jungkook wants to hug him. “I failed my driver’s. But I’ll go again! Then I can buy a car.”

 

Jungkook snorts.

 

“What, I bet you don’t have yours either. Are you even legal?”

 

“Yeah, I have mine,” Jungkook says breezily, getting up to look for snacks.

 

“Kookie, let’s go shopping,” Taehyung half whines. Jungkook finds arms around his waist and a sharp chin on his shoulder and his wolf somewhere practically preens.

 

“For what?”

 

Taehyung wonders the same as they buy their fifth white t-shirt. His heart seems to be going through some pain, but Jungkook’s smiling (smiling!!) so widely that Taehyung just grins and scrunches the alpha’s cheeks in his hands.

 

Taehyung has money. He’s been writing non-stop for two years, he’s paid off all his debts and his grandmother’s living comfortably, and there really isn’t anything else he wants to buy. But Jungkook just goes and spends his hard-earned money on brand name white t-shirts. T-shirts that sell for less than 20,000 won in Hongdae subway stations. The kid already has Timbalands, but they buy two more pairs because “Hyung, they’re comfortable.” If Yoongi scoffed at Taehyung’s purchases, he should see Jungkook now.

 

They just wander around after a while, taking time to be around each other without the influence of raging hormones. Taehyung makes Jungkook try on every ridiculous thing he finds, and Jungkook just follows the omega, peering at everything with his wide eyes.

 

Bang Bang Bang comes on in a store and Taehyung gets possessed by Daesung’s dance moves, pumping his chest like his life depends on it. He throws his arms up and rolls his hips around ridiculously, and it looks absurd but hot at the same time and Jungkook catches another alpha eyeing Taehyung from down the aisle. Jungkook positions himself between Taehyung and the alpha, but the guy starts walking towards them so before anyone knows it Jungkook’s wrapping his arms around Taehyung’s middle and walking away.

 

If Taehyung is surprised, he doesn’t show it and just laughs. “What, Kookie?”

 

“Your dancing sucks,” Jungkook mumbles by way of explanation. “It’s embarrassing.” He tries not to enjoy it too much when he lets Taehyung slide against his body to the ground.

 

“You’re cute,” Taehyung said, smiling indulgently, unaware of all the thirsty alphas on the street that Jungkook can’t unsee. The omega grabs his hand and Jungkook resists the urge to stick his tongue out, as if to say, I was here first. And then he catches himself, realises how ridiculous he sounds, and loosens his grip only to put his arms around Taehyung’s shoulders moments later.

 

Taehyung drags him into every bookstore they see to check on “his babies”, even though if they’re in the feature shelf in one bookstore, they probably will be for all of them. Seeing them there doesn’t get old, and seeing Taehyung light up like that doesn’t either. After a few grocery runs and shopping trips together, Jungkook automatically walks into every bookstore he passes, dragged by Taehyung or not.


Sometimes Taehyung’s just cuddly during heats -- more cuddly than usual, that is. Jungkook will climb into Taehyung’s bed and let Taehyung wrap himself around him. And sometimes, it takes a while for Taehyung to sleep, so he’ll pester Jungkook for stories and answers to ridiculous questions, until he discovers Jungkook’s singing voice. Then Taehyung drags Jungkook to his room, heat or no, and wraps his legs around him and scrolls on his phone for karaoke versions of his favourite songs, demanding, “Sing this, Kookie!”

 

He plays Gallant’s “Weight in Gold” one night and Jungkook’s so flustered because he doesn’t recognize the intro and it sounds American and Taehyung’s looking at him with those expectant eyes.

 

“You don’t know this?” Taehyung asks, shocked, but turns it off to find a song that Jungkook does know.

 

“No,” Jungkook muttered. He avoids Taehyung’s gaze and can only look back when he’s nailed Taeyang’s “Eyes, Nose, Lips”, earning a kiss on his cheekbone.

 

The next day Jungkook searches up the songs that he didn’t know, plays them on repeat as he works on a piece in the studio, and sings them in Taehyung’s ear at night. Taehyung smiles the most indulgent, content smile that Jungkook feels like he’s found a panacea.

 

Jungkook doesn’t tell Taehyung this, but soon traces of him are littered all over his sketches like the espresso spreading over an iced latte, taking over the blankness in artful spirals and gentle floating streaks. There’s a shot of yellow on Jungkook’s usual monochromatic works, a set of haunting eyes in his sketchbook, various candids of Taehyung in cafes, at the grocery store, sleeping in his photography portfolio.

 

It’s intimate to the point it scares Jungkook, and he doesn’t dare think about the word muse but it’s exactly what Taehyung is. Taehyung stands in the doorway of Yoongi’s studio, staring at the boy he’s half in love with (okay, completely in love with) laughing with Yoongi-hyung.

“Taehyung-hyung!” Jungkook smiles sheepishly. “Hi.”

Taehyung squints at Jungkook in his striped t-shirt and Timbalands. Then he stalks towards him, brandishing a preliminary script.

“How -- could -- you --” he grits out, whacking at Jungkook’s raised forearms, “leave -- you were here the whole time?!” Taehyung turns his crazed gaze to Jimin, who raises his arms up in a surrender position.

“Have fun,” Yoongi said soullessly, and leads Jimin out.

“Sorry Tae!” Jimin squeaks, and the door shuts.

“I’m so mad at you.” Taehyung says as he tries not to hug Jungkook to death. Actually, that sounds like a good idea. Because he wants Jungkook dead.

“After six months?” Jungkook asks, and has the audacity to smile. Since when did he smile so easily? Jungkook slowly takes a few steps towards Taehyung and wraps his arms around him slowly, giving the omega time to push him away. He doesn’t.

Taehyung wasn’t going to give in so easily when he saw Jungkook again (he’d planned his speech in the shower) but one whiff of Jungkook’s scent and Taehyung almost swoons. So he lets Jungkook envelop him and sticks his nose in the alpha’s neck, lets his body calm. He feels safe for the first time in six months.

“I’m sorry,” Jungkook mutters. “Was it hard?”

“No,” Taehyung says, crying quietly into Jungkook’s shirt. “Have you been well?”

“Working like crazy,” Jungkook laughs. “So I could see you again and not feel ashamed.”

Still stupid, Taehyung thinks. “Were you here the whole time?”

“Yeah. Yoongi hyung gave me a job here, and I sell some paintings too.”

“So I wasn’t hallucinating when I smelled you on Yoongi hyung and Jiminie?” Taehyung breaks away and slaps at Jungkook’s chest again. “Why didn’t anyone tell me? Why are you still a muscle pig?”

“I’m weak,” Jungkook says guilelessly. “I wouldn’t have let you go if I saw you again.”

Taehyung’s knees soften to jello. “And now?”

“I’ll be here, always. For as long as you’ll have me.”

It sounds deceptively simple, so Taehyung looks into Jungkook’s eyes one last time to see that it really is him and leans in for a kiss. Their scents mix together in a matter of seconds and (surprise) hands start flying everywhere, looking for skin.

“Tae? Now? Really?”

“Shut up,” Taehyung mutters. “Come home with me.”

Jungkook raises his eyebrows. He looks sexy like this, more confident and sure in his skin. “For old times’ sake?”

Taehyung laughs. “Mate me this time. Don’t chicken out,” he pushes his tattered sweater to reveal a slight scar on his collarbone. Jungkook blushes when he realizes it’s his sweater, and the events that were behind the tiny scar there. He’d wondered if Taehyung noticed the bite and how close it was to The Bite.

“There you are,” Taehyung smiled, wrapping his arms around Jungkook’s neck. “There’s my little blushing Kookie.” He jumps and wraps his legs around Jungkook without warning, but Jungkook just gives a grunt and catches him.

“Walk!” Taehyung giggles, so Jungkook takes them both out the studio.

“Did you only miss me for carrying you around?”

“And the heat relief,” Taehyung teases, nipping at Jungkook’s neck. “My dildos don’t work nearly as well.” Jungkook’s scent is strong and rich compared to the old sweaters that Taehyung has been living off of. Taehyung’s legs clench a little tighter around Jungkook’s waist.

 

“Come pick me up from the office tomorrow,” Taehyung says later that night, playing with Jungkook’s hands as they catch their breaths.

“Okay.”

“I’m going to show you off to the director so he won’t bother me anymore,” Taehyung sighs happily.

Jungkook tightens his grip on Taehyung’s hand. “He’s bothering you?”

“Yeah, since I’m unmarked and smelling like little old me--” Jungkook growls again and flips on top of Taehyung. “Since someone’s stupid and still won’t mate me--”

“You know why,” Jungkook protests, but he’s breathing rather aggressively against Taehyung’s open mouth. Something twitches against his stomach and he wonders how they could be up for round two already. “What if you regret it?”

“I won’t. I love you,” Taehyung says simply. Jungkook reels -- he wonders if his parents had given love to him this easily, before he went to art school and basically never returned their calls. Now, Jungkook thinks about showing up at his old house with pictures of his sold paintings and exhibits and – say what, exactly, he hasn’t figured out. Prove to them that he did it after all? Say sorry, for being so stubborn? Bring them money? He’s been alone for so long that Jungkook doesn’t remember how to be close to people.

“You look like you’ve never heard someone say that before,” Taehyung teases, stroking at the little baby fat left on Jungkook’s cheeks. “Kookie? Are you crying?”

“No.” Jungkook feels like the awkward and bumbling kid who’d actually start crying if someone asked if he was. Taehyung’s always been good at bringing emotions out in Jungkook. Maybe he’s been doing it – including all those ridiculous things to piss Jungkook off – so the alpha could love him and be loved.

“You are!” Taehyung looks delighted to see the wet pooling around Jungkook’s eyes and he flips them over so he can stare down at them. “My big baby--”

“Hyung!” The urge to cry and hug Taehyung into eternity ebbs away as Jungkook glares at Taehyung’s shit eating grin. “You’re not helping.”

Jungkook looks like he’s stewing on some long elaborate speech about responsibilities and love and whatever the fuck else, but Taehyung’s never been a patient person and he’s waited long enough.

“Do you love me, Kookie?”

“Um,” Jungkook rubs his nose against Taehyung’s neck for confidence. “Yes?”

“Don’t sound so sure,” Taehyung scoffs. He looks away for a second, wondering if it’s okay to be kind of disappointed. Jungkook notices.

“Hyung! I love you.” Taehyung looks down to see a bright smile starting to unfurl on Jungkook’s face and the giddiness is infectious.

“Good.” Taehyung sits back and presses his hands on Jungkook’s chest, drawing circles with his hot palms. He lifts his hips and leans forward, steadying himself on Jungkook’s firm muscles.

“Good.” Jungkook adjusts himself so he’s positioned at the right angle against Taehyung’s entrance, mind almost going mad from the heat and urgency starting all over again.

“Fine.” Taehyung hums happily as he sinks himself onto Jungkook, rolling his head around and grinning lazily.

“Fine,” Jungkook grits, and forces himself to stay still as Taehyung moves. He puts his hands on Taehyung’s hips and they squeeze when Taehyung lets out a particularly loud groan. Jungkook doesn’t know what Taehyung’s playing now but whatever it is, he’s going to win.

“Ah, Kookie,” Taehyung gasps as he sinks down slowly again. “You’re the best.”

Jungkook tries not to lose it (and the control over his ego) but his hips are starting to move and twitch without his permission.

“Ah -- Tae--”

“I want you, Kookie,” Taehyung says, leaning forward so his chest is flush with Jungkook’s. Those brown eyes pin him down again and Jungkook can barely think, but his hips are bucking and snapping up, punctuating Taehyung’s breathing with little gasps. “Don’t you think I’ve waited enough?”

 

“I’m here,” Jungkook manages to say.

“Prove it,” Taehyung gasps, voice low and husky and a little croaked. Taehyung rests his elbows against Jungkook’s shoulders and bares his neck, offering bare, tanned skin.

There’s panic at the back of Jungkook’s mind, freaking out at what his body is doing but Taehyung’s already flipped under him again with a growl and Jungkook’s licking at the skin at the omega’s neck, inhaling the smells of Taehyung and pheromones and sweat.

“Look at me, Tae.” Taehyung turns his head to look at Jungkook, eyes piercing as ever.

“Tell me you’re sure.”

“I need this, Jungkook please just do it--”

“Tell me,” Jungkook implores.

“I’m sure, Jungkook. Mate me.”

So Jungkook does.

 

Taehyung wakes up with his heart bursting. There’s a cheesy, rectangular grin on his face even when he pecks at Jungkook’s still sleeping face and heads for a shower; it only widens when he feels arms around him as he’s making breakfast.

Being with Jungkook has always been comfortable, but there’s a solidness and sureness to being mated, where all he wants in life is to be near Jungkook.

Jungkook looks a little bewildered, and he won’t stop touching Taehyung at all times. He leaves his hand on Taehyung’s as they eat, and slots their sides together as they brush teeth, and jams his chin into Taehyung’s shoulder to look at what his mate is doing. Taehyung’s buzzing happily from all the places Jungkook absentmindedly touches.

Taehyung shows up to his meeting proudly sporting the scent of a newly mated wolf and Jungkook at his heels, glaring at all the alphas and betas for good measure. He stands with his chin on Taehyung’s shoulder and arms around his waist as they wait in line for drinks at the café, and doesn’t leave until he properly scents his mate in front of everyone, including the hotshot alpha director.

Yoongi finds Jungkook at his appointment reeking of Taehyung and tells him to put on cologne because it’s gross (even though Jungkook thinks it’s unfair when he’s started to associate Yoongi and Jimin’s scents as one identity) but he pats Jungkook’s head in silent, stoic approval.

Jimin visits the studio that day and whiffs at Jungkook’s arm suspiciously (“What the hell, hyung?”) before starting to squeal something about how this was all his idea.

When Jungkook’s lease ends, he moves back into Taehyung’s apartment and reclaims that spot on the sofa as his editing seat. Taehyung still sits there sometimes in Jungkook’s sweater and flips through the sketchbook whenever his mate’s out late for a shoot.
